intro: Solandra hartwegii, commonly known as the night-blooming cereus, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy, white flowers that open at night. The plant has a woody stem with spiny branches and produces yellowish-orange berries that contain seeds. Its flowers emit a strong, sweet fragrance to attract nocturnal pollinators like moths. Solandra hartwegii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and unique blooming habit.
